p: Concerning E. coli, throughout the experiment, no blue/gray colonies were detected on Tryptone Bile Glucuronic Agar (TBX agar), therefore all the samples are characterized as safe for human consumption, with regard to the E. coli microorganism. As for Salmonella spp., the experiments carried out showed that: at the weight of 25 g of the sample and 225 mL of Peptone Buffered Water, the microorganism was not detected, so the samples were considered safe for consumption, with respect to the Salmonella spp. Also, in all samples, S. aureus could not be detected. Finally, for A. niger, throughout the experiments, the samples are found to be free of mold and fungi and are considered safe for consumption.
